org.apache.juneau.remoteable

Class RemoteableMethodMeta

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.remoteable.RemoteableMethodMeta

  • public class RemoteableMethodMeta
extends Object
    Contains the meta-data about a Java method on a remoteable interface.

    Captures the information in @RemoteMethod annotations for caching and reuse.

    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client > Interface Proxies Against 3rd-party REST Interfaces

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteableMethodMeta(String restUrl, Method m)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Integer getBodyArg()
      Returns the argument annotated with @Body.
      RemoteMethodArg[] getFormDataArgs()
      Returns the @FormData annotated arguments on this Java method.
      RemoteMethodArg[] getHeaderArgs()
      Returns the @Header annotated arguments on this Java method.
      String getHttpMethod()
      Returns the value of the @RemoteMethod.httpMethod() annotation on this Java method.
      Integer[] getOtherArgs()
      Returns the remaining non-annotated arguments on this Java method.
      RemoteMethodArg[] getPathArgs()
      Returns the @Path annotated arguments on this Java method.
      RemoteMethodArg[] getQueryArgs()
      Returns the @Query annotated arguments on this Java method.
      RemoteMethodArg[] getRequestBeanArgs()
      Returns the @RequestBean annotated arguments on this Java method.
      ReturnValue getReturns()
      Returns whether the method returns the HTTP response body or status code.
      String getUrl()
      Returns the absolute URL of the REST interface invoked by this Java method.

        Constructor.

        restUrl - The absolute URL of the REST interface backing the interface proxy.

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpMethod

        public String getHttpMethod()
        Returns the value of the @RemoteMethod.httpMethod() annotation on this Java method.
        Returns:
        The value of the annotation, never null.

      • getUrl

        public String getUrl()
        Returns the absolute URL of the REST interface invoked by this Java method.
        Returns:
        The absolute URL of the REST interface, never null.

      • getPathArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getPathArgs()
        Returns the @Path annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @Path.value() names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getQueryArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getQueryArgs()
        Returns the @Query annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @Query.value() names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getFormDataArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getFormDataArgs()
        Returns the @FormData annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @FormData.value() names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getHeaderArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getHeaderArgs()
        Returns the @Header annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @Header.value() names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getRequestBeanArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getRequestBeanArgs()
        Returns the @RequestBean annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A list of zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getOtherArgs

        public Integer[] getOtherArgs()
        Returns the remaining non-annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A list of zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getBodyArg

        public Integer getBodyArg()
        Returns the argument annotated with @Body.
        Returns:
        A index of the argument with the @Body annotation, or null if no argument exists.

      • getReturns

        public ReturnValue getReturns()
        Returns whether the method returns the HTTP response body or status code.
        Returns:
        Whether the method returns the HTTP response body or status code.
